nars.entity

Class Sentence

  • java.lang.Object
    • nars.entity.Sentence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Sentence
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A Sentence is an abstract class, mainly containing a Term, a TruthValue, and a Stamp.

    It is used as the premises and conclusions of all inference rules.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Term content
      The content of a Sentence is a Term
      char punctuation
      The punctuation also indicates the type of the Sentence: Judgment, Question, Goal, or Quest.
      Stamp stamp
      Partial record of the derivation path
      TruthValue truth
      The truth value of Judgment, or desire value of Goal

    • Field Detail

      • content

        public final Term content
        The content of a Sentence is a Term

      • punctuation

        public final char punctuation
        The punctuation also indicates the type of the Sentence: Judgment, Question, Goal, or Quest. Represented by characters: '.', '?', '!', or '@'

      • truth

        public final TruthValue truth
        The truth value of Judgment, or desire value of Goal

      • stamp

        public final Stamp stamp
        Partial record of the derivation path

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sentence

        public Sentence(Term content,
                char punctuation,
                TruthValue truth,
                Stamp stamp)
        Create a Sentence with the given fields
        Parameters:
        content - The Term that forms the content of the sentence
        punctuation - The punctuation indicating the type of the sentence
        truth - The truth value of the sentence, null for question
        stamp - The stamp of the sentence indicating its derivation time and base
